segment.source: Manage Administrative Backup and Restore in UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Manage Administrative Backup and Restore in UE-V 2.x

segment.source: Manage Administrative Backup and Restore in UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Manage Administrative Backup and Restore in UE-V 2.x

segment.source: Manage Administrative Backup and Restore in UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Manage Administrative Backup and Restore in UE-V 2.x

segment.source: As an administrator of Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0, 2.1, or 2.1 SP1, you can restore application and Windows settings to their original state.
segment.target: As an administrator of Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0, 2.1, or 2.1 SP1, you can restore application and Windows settings to their original state.

segment.source: And new in UE-V 2.1, you can also restore additional settings when a user adopts a new device.
segment.target: And new in UE-V 2.1, you can also restore additional settings when a user adopts a new device.

segment.source: Restore Settings in UE-V 2.1 or UE-V 2.1 SP1 when a User Adopts a New Device
segment.target: Restore Settings in UE-V 2.1 or UE-V 2.1 SP1 when a User Adopts a New Device

segment.source: To restore settings when a user adopts a new device, you can put a settings location template in backup or roam (default) profile using the Set-UevTemplateProfile PowerShell cmdlet.
segment.target: To restore settings when a user adopts a new device, you can put a settings location template in backup or roam (default) profile using the Set-UevTemplateProfile PowerShell cmdlet.

segment.source: This lets computer settings sync to the new computer, in addition to user settings.
segment.target: This lets computer settings sync to the new computer, in addition to user settings.

segment.source: Templates assigned to the backup profile are backed up for that device and configured on a per-device basis.
segment.target: Templates assigned to the backup profile are backed up for that device and configured on a per-device basis.

segment.source: To backup settings for a template, use the following cmdlet in Windows PowerShell:
segment.target: To backup settings for a template, use the following cmdlet in Windows PowerShell:

segment.source: TemplateID is the UE-V Template ID
segment.target: TemplateID is the UE-V Template ID

segment.source: backup can either be Backup or Roaming
segment.target: backup can either be Backup or Roaming

segment.source: When replacing a user’s device UE-V automatically restores settings if the user’s domain, username, and device name all match.
segment.target: When replacing a user’s device UE-V automatically restores settings if the user’s domain, username, and device name all match.

segment.source: All synchronized and any backup data is restored on the device automatically.
segment.target: All synchronized and any backup data is restored on the device automatically.

segment.source: You can also use the new PowerShell cmdlet, Restore-UevBackup, to restore settings from a different device.
segment.target: You can also use the new PowerShell cmdlet, Restore-UevBackup, to restore settings from a different device.

segment.source: To clone the settings packages for the new device, use the following cmdlet in Windows PowerShell:
segment.target: To clone the settings packages for the new device, use the following cmdlet in Windows PowerShell:

segment.source: where MachineName is the computer name of the device.
segment.target: where MachineName is the computer name of the device.

segment.source: Templates such as the Office 2013 template that include many applications can either all be included in the roamed (default) or backed up profile.
segment.target: Templates such as the Office 2013 template that include many applications can either all be included in the roamed (default) or backed up profile.

segment.source: Individual apps in a template suite follow the group.
segment.target: Individual apps in a template suite follow the group.

segment.source: Office 2013 in-box templates include both roaming and backup-only settings.
segment.target: Office 2013 in-box templates include both roaming and backup-only settings.

segment.source: Backup-only settings cannot be included in a roaming profile.
segment.target: Backup-only settings cannot be included in a roaming profile.

segment.source: As part of the Backup/Restore feature, UE-V added last known good (LKG) to the options for rolling back to settings.
segment.target: As part of the Backup/Restore feature, UE-V added last known good (LKG) to the options for rolling back to settings.

segment.source: In this release, you can roll back to either the original settings or LKG settings.
segment.target: In this release, you can roll back to either the original settings or LKG settings.

segment.source: The LKG settings let users roll back to an intermediate and stable point ahead of the pre-UE-V state of the settings.
segment.target: The LKG settings let users roll back to an intermediate and stable point ahead of the pre-UE-V state of the settings.

segment.source: How to Backup/Restore Templates with UE-V
segment.target: How to Backup/Restore Templates with UE-V

segment.source: These are the key backup and restore components of UE-V:
segment.target: These are the key backup and restore components of UE-V:

segment.source: Template profiles
segment.target: Template profiles

segment.source: Settings packages location within the Settings Storage Location template
segment.target: Settings packages location within the Settings Storage Location template

segment.source: Backup trigger
segment.target: Backup trigger

segment.source: How settings are restored
segment.target: How settings are restored

segment.source: Template Profiles
segment.target: Template Profiles

segment.source: A UE-V template profile is defined when the template is registered on the device or post registration through the PowerShell/WMI configuration utility.
segment.target: A UE-V template profile is defined when the template is registered on the device or post registration through the PowerShell/WMI configuration utility.

segment.source: The profile types include:
segment.target: The profile types include:

segment.source: Roaming (default)
segment.target: Roaming (default)

segment.source: Backup
segment.target: Backup

segment.source: BackupOnly
segment.target: BackupOnly

segment.source: All templates are included in the roaming profile when registered unless otherwise specified.
segment.target: All templates are included in the roaming profile when registered unless otherwise specified.

segment.source: These templates synchronize settings to all UE-V enabled devices with the corresponding template enabled.
segment.target: These templates synchronize settings to all UE-V enabled devices with the corresponding template enabled.

segment.source: Templates can be added to the Backup Profile with PowerShell or WMI using the Set-UevTemplateProfile cmdlet.
segment.target: Templates can be added to the Backup Profile with PowerShell or WMI using the Set-UevTemplateProfile cmdlet.

segment.source: Templates in the Backup Profile back up these settings to the Settings Storage Location in a special Device name directory.
segment.target: Templates in the Backup Profile back up these settings to the Settings Storage Location in a special Device name directory.

segment.source: Specified settings are backed up to this location.
segment.target: Specified settings are backed up to this location.

segment.source: Templates designated BackupOnly include settings specific to that device that should not be synchronized unless explicitly restored.
segment.target: Templates designated BackupOnly include settings specific to that device that should not be synchronized unless explicitly restored.

segment.source: These settings are stored in the same device-specific settings package location on the settings storage location as the Backedup Settings.
segment.target: These settings are stored in the same device-specific settings package location on the settings storage location as the Backedup Settings.

segment.source: These templates have a special identifier embedded in the template that specifies they should be part of this profile.
segment.target: These templates have a special identifier embedded in the template that specifies they should be part of this profile.

segment.source: Settings packages location within the Settings Storage Location template
segment.target: Settings packages location within the Settings Storage Location template

segment.source: Roaming Profile settings are stored on the settings storage location.
segment.target: Roaming Profile settings are stored on the settings storage location.

segment.source: Templates assigned to the Backup or the BackupOnly profile store their settings to the Settings Storage Location in a special Device name directory.
segment.target: Templates assigned to the Backup or the BackupOnly profile store their settings to the Settings Storage Location in a special Device name directory.

segment.source: Each device with templates in these profiles has its own device name.
segment.target: Each device with templates in these profiles has its own device name.

segment.source: UE-V does not clean up these directories.
segment.target: UE-V does not clean up these directories.

segment.source: Backup trigger
segment.target: Backup trigger

segment.source: Backup is triggered by the same events that trigger a UE-V synchronization.
segment.target: Backup is triggered by the same events that trigger a UE-V synchronization.

segment.source: How settings are restored
segment.target: How settings are restored

segment.source: Restoring a user’s device restores the currently registered Template’s settings from another device’s backup folder and all synchronized settings to the current machine.
segment.target: Restoring a user’s device restores the currently registered Template’s settings from another device’s backup folder and all synchronized settings to the current machine.

segment.source: Settings are restored in these two ways:
segment.target: Settings are restored in these two ways:

segment.source: Automatic restore
segment.target: Automatic restore

segment.source: If the user’s UE-V settings storage path, domain, and Computer name match the current user then all of the settings for that user are synchronized, with only the latest settings applied.
segment.target: If the user’s UE-V settings storage path, domain, and Computer name match the current user then all of the settings for that user are synchronized, with only the latest settings applied.

segment.source: If a user logs on to a new device for the first time and these criteria are met, the settings data is applied to that device.
segment.target: If a user logs on to a new device for the first time and these criteria are met, the settings data is applied to that device.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Accessibility and Windows Desktop settings require the user to re-logon to Windows to be applied.
segment.target: Accessibility and Windows Desktop settings require the user to re-logon to Windows to be applied.

segment.source: Manual Restore
segment.target: Manual Restore

segment.source: If you want to assist users by restoring a device during a refresh, you can choose to use the Restore-UevBackup cmdlet.
segment.target: If you want to assist users by restoring a device during a refresh, you can choose to use the Restore-UevBackup cmdlet.

segment.source: This command ensures that the user’s current settings become the current state on the Settings Storage Location.
segment.target: This command ensures that the user’s current settings become the current state on the Settings Storage Location.

segment.source: Restore Application and Windows Settings to Original State
segment.target: Restore Application and Windows Settings to Original State

segment.source: WMI and Windows PowerShell commands let you restore application and Windows settings to the settings values that were on the computer the first time that the application started after the UE-V Agent was installed.
segment.target: WMI and Windows PowerShell commands let you restore application and Windows settings to the settings values that were on the computer the first time that the application started after the UE-V Agent was installed.

segment.source: This restoring action is performed on a per-application or Windows settings basis.
segment.target: This restoring action is performed on a per-application or Windows settings basis.

segment.source: The settings are restored the next time that the application runs, or the settings are restored when the user logs on to the operating system.
segment.target: The settings are restored the next time that the application runs, or the settings are restored when the user logs on to the operating system.

segment.source: To restore application settings and Windows settings with Windows PowerShell for UE-V 2.x
segment.target: To restore application settings and Windows settings with Windows PowerShell for UE-V 2.x

segment.source: Open the Windows PowerShell window.
segment.target: Open the Windows PowerShell window.

segment.source: Enter the following Windows PowerShell cmdlet to restore the application settings and Windows settings.
segment.target: Enter the following Windows PowerShell cmdlet to restore the application settings and Windows settings.

segment.source: Windows PowerShell cmdlet
segment.target: Windows PowerShell cmdlet

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Restores the user settings for an application or restores a group of Windows settings.
segment.target: Restores the user settings for an application or restores a group of Windows settings.

segment.source: To restore application settings and Windows settings with WMI
segment.target: To restore application settings and Windows settings with WMI

segment.source: Open a Windows PowerShell window.
segment.target: Open a Windows PowerShell window.

segment.source: Enter the following WMI command to restore application settings and Windows settings.
segment.target: Enter the following WMI command to restore application settings and Windows settings.

segment.source: WMI command
segment.target: WMI command

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Restores the user settings for an application or restores a group of Windows settings.
segment.target: Restores the user settings for an application or restores a group of Windows settings.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: UE-V does not provide a settings rollback for Windows apps.
segment.target: UE-V does not provide a settings rollback for Windows apps.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for UE-V?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.target: For UE-V issues, use the UE-V TechNet Forum.
